byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

abstract: Saudi Arabia agrees to halt its military operations against Houthi rebels in Yemen for five days to allow delivery of humanitarian aid, but violence does not let up; aid agency Oxfam says nearly half country is in need of food and nearly six million are facing starvation.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia had promised to cease fighting so that groups could deliver aid to millions of starving Yemenis, but there was no indication that would happen on Monday as planned.

headline.main: Lack of Pause in Yemen War Delays Aid
headline.print_headline: Lack of Pause in Yemen War Delays Aid

snippet: Saudi Arabia had promised to cease fighting so that groups could deliver aid to millions of starving Yemenis, but there was no indication that would happen on Monday as planned.
